Descriptions: Metrics related to accuracy, such as accuracy, error, AUC, precision, reall and F-score.
Metrics capturing model complexity, e.g. the number of leaves in a decision tree.
Metrics related to classification cost, such as cost of misclassification and cost matrix.
Other less frequently used metrics like cross-entropy and Cohen k.
Metric capturing comphrehensibility of results and ease of use, for example.
Metrics used to rank models, e.g. Friedman ranking and mean rank of error rate.
Statistical tests used to compare models, such as t-test, Wilcoxon test and Duncan's multiple range test.
Metrics like training and prediction time.
